summary: This is an email chain from October 2021 between law enforcement officials (NYPD/FBI) and a federal prosecutor regarding a list of potential testifying witnesses in a case. The sender requests additional information on the witnesses, such as DOB, age, reason for testifying, and location, and asks for rap sheets to be run on them.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Officer
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting more information on a list of potential witnesses and asking for rap sheets to be run.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The recipient of the email, based at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, who provided the initial list of potential witnesses.

connections.description: The detective is requesting follow-up information and background checks (rap sheets) from the prosecutor regarding a list of witnesses for a case.

events.title: Initial Witness List Provided
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends a list of potential testifying witnesses to law enforcement.

events.title: Follow-up Request for Witness Information
events.description: A detective from the NYPD/FBI task force requests more detailed information and background checks on the list of witnesses.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain from October 2021 concerning witness preparation for a case, likely related to child exploitation or human trafficking.
Law enforcement is requesting detailed background information (DOB, age, origin, testimony reason) and rap sheets for a list of 20 potential witnesses.

The correspondence involves collaboration between a federal prosecutor (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York and a detective from a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The document references an attached list of 20 witnesses, but their identities are not disclosed in the provided text.
